Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of probably the Minotaur's raised left arm grasped on wrist by Theseus' left hand; at right, youth with added red hair and black fillet, to left, with right hand raised, cloak decorated with red roundels with added white dots around them over upper right arm and shoulder.
Curator's comments: For Theseus grasping the Minotaur’s wrist, see the amphorae Vatican 313 (ABV, 125, no. 37; Albizzati, C., Vasi antichi dipinti del Vaticano. Rome 1925-35, pl. 32) and London B 148 (ABV, 109, no. 29; Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 66.2; Add2, 30). See also Brommer, F., Vasenlisten zur griechischen Heldensage. Marburg 1973, 237, no. A28.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.20)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 263, no. 34)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 205, no. B16)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0071) (Phase 1)
